utterance.speaker: C.H.E.E.S.E
utterance.content: You can say that again Mac.

utterance.speaker: Mac
utterance.content: Well, I couldn’t have done it without you buddy. You’re a genius.

utterance.speaker: C.H.E.E.S.E
utterance.content: Oh yeah? Well then how come I can’t get my VCR to stop blinking 12:00?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: So, what did you guys think?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hello? Hold on please. Joey, it’s your mom.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: It’s your mommy. It’s your mommy.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Ohhhh…

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: That’s nice.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Mom, so what did you think?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well that was umm…Okay.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: It wasn’t the best.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: That was one of the worse things ever. And not just on TV.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Wh-what are we gonna tell him?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, the lighting was okay.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ohh no you don’t! You got lighting last time, lighting is mine!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: And I have costumes.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh great! That means I’m stuck with, "So, we were watching you in there and you were sittin’ right here! Whoa!"

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What are you gonna do Pheebs?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I don’t know. I don’t know. I can’t lie to him again. Oh no I—no! I’m just gonna press my breasts up against him.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: And say nothing?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Uh-huh, yeah that’s right.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Wow! Well, my folks really liked it! So what-what did you guys think? It wasn’t that good.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Phoebe, do you think that your favorite animal says much about you?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What? You mean behind my back?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh! Hi you guys, oh my God! You’ll never gonna believe happened to me today! I am sitting in my office and…

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You guys! You guys! You’re not gonna believe what my agent just told me!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Joey! Kinda in the middle of a story here!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ooh, sorry. Sorry. You finish, go.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay, so anyway I’m sittin’ in my office and guess who walks in.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I’m gonna be on two TV shows!

utterance.speaker: Monica and Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, that’s great!!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Joey!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, you weren’t finished?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah! Guess who walks into my office is the end of my story. It was Ralph Lauren! Ralph Lauren walked into my office!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Uh Rach, if you’re gonna start another story, at least let me finish mine.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: It’s the same story.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Wow, it’s really long.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Anyway, Ralph just came in to tell me that he’s so happy with my work that he wants me to be the new merchandising manager for polo retail.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Still get a discount on wedding dresses?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I’m so happy for you!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well, these really are the days of our lives.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well, since you ask. They want me back on Days of Our Lives!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh God!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I got—I get a big pay raise!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh hey!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I’ll be playing Drake Remoray’s twin brother, Stryker!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oooh!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I get to hire my own assistant!

utterance.speaker: Monica and Phoebe
utterance.content: Ahhh!!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well—I got a head rush from standing up to fast right there.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: And you were at this job for four years?

utterance.speaker: Hilda
utterance.content: That’s right.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay, well this is all very impressive Hilda, um I just have one last question for you. Uh, how did I do? Was this okay?

utterance.speaker: Hilda
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I’ve never interviewed anyone before. I’ve actually never had anyone work for me before. Although when I was a kid, we did have a maid, but this is-this isn’t the same thing.

utterance.speaker: Hilda
utterance.content: No dear. It’s not.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No. Yeah, and I know that. All right, well thank you so much for coming in it was nice to meet you.

utterance.speaker: Hilda
utterance.content: Thank you! Good meeting you.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: All right. I’m a total pro!

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Hello?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Wow! H-umm! Hi! Yes, uh I’m sorry the models are actually down the hall.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Actually, I’m here about the assistant job.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Really?! Okay well then, all right, well just have a seat there. Umm, so what’s—what is—what’s your name?

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Tag Jones.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Uh-huh, go on.

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: That’s it. That’s my whole name.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: That’s your whole name, okay of course it is! Okay, well let’s-let’s just have a look-see here.

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: I know I haven’t worked in an office before, and I really don’t have a lot of experience, but uh…

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh come on, what are you talking about? You’ve got three years painting houses. Two whole summers at T.G.I. Friday’s, come on!

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: It’s lame, I know. But I’m a goal-oriented person, very eager to learn…

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay, hold on just a second. I’m sorry, it’s for human resources, everybody has to do it. Could you just stand up please?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No-no-no-no. Hey!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Anyway, I should go. Okay, bye.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey sweetie.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hi sweetie. So, what was with all the whispering?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I can’t tell you. It’s a secret.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Secret? Married people aren’t supposed to have secrets between one another. We have too much love and respect for one another.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Awww. But still no.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No I’m serious, we should tell each other everything. I do not have any secrets from you.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Really? Okay, so why don’t you tell me what happened to Ross Junior year at Disneyland?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh no-no, I can’t do that.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: If you tell me, I’ll tell you what Phoebe said.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: So, Ross and I are going to Disneyland and we stop at this restaurant for tacos. And when I say restaurant, I mean a guy, a hibachi, and the trunk of his car. So Ross has about 10 tacos. And anyway, we’re on Space Mountain and Ross starts to feel a little iffy.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh my God. He threw up?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No, he visited a little town south of throw up. So what was Phoebe’s secret?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, Nancy Thompson from Phoebe’s old massage place is getting fired.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: That’s it?! I gave up my Disneyland story for that?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: That’s right! You lose sucker!! Please still marry me.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Chandler, you have an assistant right?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Did she call? You-you told her I was sick right? Always tell her I am sick!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No, I-I just don’t know how you decide who to hire. I mean I’ve got it narrowed down to two people. One of them has great references and a lot of experience and then there’s this guy…

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What about him?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I love him. He’s so pretty I wanna cry! I don’t know what to do. Tell me what to do.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Come on you know what to do! You hire the first one! You don’t hire an assistant because they’re cute, you hire them because they’re qualified.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Uh-huh. No, I hear what you’re saying and-and-and that makes a lot of sense but can I just say one more thing? Look how pretty!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Let’s see. Oh my God! Oh… But no! No! You can’t-you can’t hire him, because that—it’s not professional. Umm, this is for me yes? Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay you’re right. I’ll hire Hilda tomorrow. Dumb old perfect for the job Hilda!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Let me see this guy. W-H-Wow! Don’t show this to Monica! And don’t tell her about the W-H-Wow!

utterance.speaker: Terry
utterance.content: Hey-hey-hey Joey!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey Terry!

utterance.speaker: Terry
utterance.content: Good to see you again!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: It’s been a while, huh? Wow, it’s funny these halls look smaller then they used to.

utterance.speaker: Terry
utterance.content: It’s a different building.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: So! Stryker Remoray huh? When do you want me to start?

utterance.speaker: Terry
utterance.content: Why don’t we start right now!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Terry
utterance.content: Here are the audition scenes.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Audition? I thought you were gonna offer me the part.

utterance.speaker: Terry
utterance.content: Why would you think that?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well, I was Dr. Drake Remoray, Stryker’s twin brother. I mean, who looks more me than me right?

utterance.speaker: Terry
utterance.content: Everybody has to audition.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Y’know Terry, I-I don’t really need to do this. I got my own cable TV series, with a robot.

utterance.speaker: Terry
utterance.content: I’m sorry Joey that’s…that’s the way it is.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well. I guess you think you’re pretty special huh? Sittin’ up here in your fancy small hall building. Makin’ stars jump through hoops for ya, huh? Well y’know what? This is one star who’s hoop… This is a star that the hoop—this hoop—I was Dr. Drake Remoray!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi! Tag. What are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: I just wanted to come by and thank you for not laughing in my face yesterday. And I noticed there aren’t any plants in your office so I wanted to bring you your first… There is a plant in your office.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Kinda.

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: Right. So I guess I shouldn’t put good at noticing stuff on my resume.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh-ohh, thank you.

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: Anyway, I’m guessing you hired somebody.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well…

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: Gotcha. Thanks again for meeting with me.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: But I hired you!

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah! You-you got the job! You’re my new assistant!

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: I am?!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah!

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: I can’t believe it!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Me either. Umm, all right, first thing I need you to do is go downstairs and find a women named Hilda and tell her to go home.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey! Good, you’re home!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh it’s always nicer to here than, "Aw crap! You again!"

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey baby.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I made you a surprise.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh yeah?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah, tacos! Ever since you told me that story I’ve had such a craving for them.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Did you not understand the story?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey! What’s up?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ross!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, nothin’ much. Just trying to figure out what I’m gonna do for dinner.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Huh.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey—Ooh! What’s-what’s that, dinner stuff? You making dinner?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No! Shhh!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What you got over there? Tacos?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No! No. They’re umm… They’re just uh…ground beef smileys.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Uhh, those are tacos.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Excuse me Mr. Mexico.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Eh, either way I’ll pass. I still can’t eat those. What’s so funny?!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I’m not laughing.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You told her!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Nancy Thompson’s getting fired!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Look, okay-okay I had food poisoning! It’s not like I choose to do it! It’s not like—It’s not like I said, "Umm, what would make this ride more fun?!"

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You’re right. I mean I’m sorry. Yeah, I shouldn’t be laughing. I should be laying down papers for you!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: How could you tell her?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I had too okay?! We’re getting married! Married couples can’t keep secrets from one another!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh really? Well I-I guess Monica should know about Atlantic City.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Du-ude!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What happened in Atlantic City?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, Chandler and I are in a bar…

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Did you not hear me say, "Du-ude?!"

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: And this girl is making eyes at Chandler, okay? So after awhile he-he goes over to her and uh, after a minute or two, I see them kissing. Now, I know what you’re thinking, Chandler’s not the type of guy who just goes to bars and makes out with girls, and you’re right, Chandler’s not the type of guy who just goes to bars and makes out with…girls.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You kissed a guy?!! Oh my God.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: In my defense, it was dark and he was a very pretty guy.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh Mon, I laughed so hard…

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ho-ho, so hard we had to throw out your underwear again?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Whatever dude, you kissed a guy.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey—Ooh, how’s Hilda? Is she working out?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ohh, my new assistant is working out, yes.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Was she happy you gave her the job?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, my-my new assistant has very happy that I hired my new assistant.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hello? Oh hey! Can you, can you hang on a second? It’s the producers over at Mac and C.H.E.E.S.E. can you excuse me for a minute? Hey, funny you should call. I was just looking over next week’s script. Canceled?! Like they’re taking it off the air? Ohh. All right, see you Monday. We’re not even shootin’ them anymore?!! All right, bye! They canceled Mac and C.H.E.E.S.E!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Sorry.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I’m sorry Joey.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Why would they do that?! It was a good show right?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You wanna tell secrets?! Okay! Okay! In college, Ross used to wear leg warmers!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: All right! All right! Chandler entered a Vanilla Ice look-a-like contest and won!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ross came in forth and cried!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh my God!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, is that funny?! Oh, you-you find that funny?! Well maybe Chandler should know some of your secrets too!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I-I already told him everything! You shush!!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Once Monica was sent to her room without dinner, so she ate the macaroni off a jewelry box she’d made.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ross used to stay up every Saturday night to watch Golden Girls!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Monica couldn’t tell time ‘til she was 13!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: It’s hard for some people!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Of course it is. Wow—whoa!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Chandler one time wore my underwear to work!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey!!!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ohh, I’m sorry I couldn’t think of anymore for Ross!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Ohh! Ohh! In college, Chandler got drunk and slept with the lady who cleaned our dorm!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: That was you!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Whatever dude, you kissed a guy.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: How could this happen to me?! Yesterday I had two TV shows! Today, I got nothin’!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well wait a minute, what happened to Days of Our Lives?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Uh, well they might be a little mad at me over there.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What happened?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well maybe I got a little upset and maybe I told them where they could go.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Joey, why would you do that?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Because they wanted me to audition!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You! An actor?! That’s madness!

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: Rachel Green’s office.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Tag? Hi, who was that?

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: Nobody. I was just practicing.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: Hi! Rachel Green’s office.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You must be Hilda.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, this is Tag. Tag, this is Phoebe. Phoebe, can I see you for a second?

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: Phoebe! That’s a great name.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, you like that? You should hear my phone number.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay. We’ll be right back.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: So you hired yourself a little treat did ya?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: All right I know, I know how it looks Pheebs, but I’m telling you…

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: But-but you know you cannot get involved with your assistant.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yes, I know that. I know that. And I know that hiring him was probably not the smartest thing that I’ve ever done. But I’m telling you, from this moment on I swear this is strictly professional. Yes?

utterance.speaker: Kathy
utterance.content: Hey Rachel!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Kathy
utterance.content: Cute assistant! What’s his story? Is he…

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Gay? Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey! Terry.

utterance.speaker: Terry
utterance.content: Joey Tribbiani! I’m surprised your big head could fit through our small halls! I gotta go Joey.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Wait! Terry! Wait—Look—Wait I-I… Look, I’m really sorry about before. I was an idiot thinking I’m too big to audition for you. You gotta give me another chance.

utterance.speaker: Terry
utterance.content: I can’t help you Joey.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Wait! Terry! Please! Look, I just lost my other job. Okay? You have no idea how much I need this. Please, help me out, for old times sake.

utterance.speaker: Dr. Stryker Remoray
utterance.content: Good morning. Drake, it’s your brother Stryker. Can you hear me?

utterance.speaker: The Director
utterance.content: And cut!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I’m back baby! Ha-ha-ha!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Y’know, in my defense, umm there was no glitter on the macaroni and very little glue.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: And in my defense, the cleaning lady came on to me!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You have no trouble telling time now right?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Quick! What time is it?!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I don’t know! Time to kiss a guy maybe?! What are you laughing at Pampers?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Y’know when I said that because we’re getting married that we should share everything and not have any secrets?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah that was stupid. Let’s not do that.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ohh, absolutely.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: And! We should keep all the stuff uh, we told each other secret from everybody else.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah, definitely!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay, if you’ll excuse me, I-I’m gonna go hang out with some people who don’t know the Space Mountain story.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Then, I’d steer clear of Phoebe.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Man!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, and not that you would, but I wouldn’t hang out with…all the guys in my office.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: Do you have a minute?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well yeah, sure, what’s up?

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: I got asked out twice today when I was at lunch…by guys.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh really?!

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: Yeah. Did you tell someone that I was gay?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, did you not want people to know that?

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: But I’m not gay. And I especially wouldn’t want you to think I was gay.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Why’s that?

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: I don’t think I should say.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ohh, you can say. Come on, I don’t want you to feel like you can’t tell me things.

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: ‘Kay.

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: Well…

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: I’d love to ask out your friend Phoebe.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, she’s gay.
